page.title: 165th BOURNE SCOUTS (contd.)
page.content: Guide Association own the land called 'Heron's Way', here guides from all over Surrey come to camp. The scouts and cubs have a very busy year, for besides the normal scouting activities they have a canoe Derby, boot and jumble sales,an annual fete held in Langham's Field, Swimming galas, a 'Father and Son' camp etc. Every two months they have a paper collection when the local residents are invited to put their old newspapers in a skip _ this helps to raise funds for new equipment etc. Each year the cubs have a pack holiday in Swanage and the scouts have a weeks activity camp where they can do pot- holing, hill walking, caving, canoeing etc. This year they went to Wales. The 5th Bourne has a Venture Troop with 18 members .
